cycles.note: Cycle 1 used hardcoded extraction rules, not LLM reasoning. Results were template-generated. Retained for baseline comparison only.

cycles.master_synthesis: Cycle 3 reveals a US economy in structural bifurcation. Sectors exposed to AI cost disruption (professional services -0.4%, transportation -0.9%) are entering the liquidation cascade while labor-absorbing sectors (healthcare +2.6%) face permanent shortages amplified by immigration policy. The critical insight is that these are not separate stories — they are two sides of the same structural shift, and the opportunity corridor sits at their intersection. Bond markets (HY spread 2.87%) have not priced this divergence, meaning the distress window is open but not yet crowded. The 1000x inference cost reduction confirms P1 infrastructure overhang, making H1 entry timing optimal for agentic-first businesses that consume cheap compute rather than build it.

cross_principle_patterns.evidence: Prof services -97K jobs while healthcare +709K. Same economy, opposite directions.
C&I loans down $55.8B while delinquency stable. Incumbents denied restructuring capital.
1000x inference cost reduction makes $37/hr human labor look like 37-370x overpay for many tasks.
HY spread 2.87% (tight) while Ch.11 +76% YoY. Market mispricing = timing window.

emergent_principles.name: Timing Arbitrage (potential P7)
emergent_principles.description: Companies cutting human capacity before AI can replace it, creating service vacuums.

top_opportunities.name: Distressed Professional Services Acquisition + Agentic Rebuild
Healthcare Staffing Gap — AI-Augmented Nurse Capacity Multiplier

next_cycle_direction: Deep-dive Agent B verification on top 2 opportunities (Distressed Prof Services, Healthcare Staffing)
Run competitor scans on both via Agent A
Increase weight on data_specificity (1.3) — need real acquisition prices, real client book sizes
Decrease weight on novelty (0.7) — we have the themes, now need unit economics depth
Add LATAM scanning pass: are the same cascades happening in Argentina/Brazil?
Investigate the P7 Timing Arbitrage hypothesis: which industries cut humans prematurely?

cycles.master_synthesis: Cycle 6 is the counter-signal revolution — the first cycle where the engine confronted its own conclusions with serious counter-evidence, and the conclusions lost. All three top opportunities from Cycle 3 were materially undermined: Healthcare Staffing AI killed by federal legislation explicitly banning technology as nurse ratio substitute (H.R. 3415 / S. 1709); Agentic SMB Back-Office killed by incumbent moat (Intuit 80%+ share, $100M OpenAI partnership) and catastrophic precedent failure (Bench.co $113M, Pilot $325M for 0.4%); Distressed Professional Services parked due to competitive landscape saturation ($500M+ from Crete, $75M Accrual, $314M revenue Ascend, 147 PE deals totaling $200B). The kill index is populated for the first time with 2 entries. This is not a failure of the engine — it is the engine reaching maturity. The Principles Engine correctly identified WHERE disruption happens. The counter-signal framework now tells us whether WE can be the disruptors.

counter_signal_revolution.description: Cycle 6 marks the transition from 'what should be disrupted' to 'what can WE disrupt'. Previous cycles identified macro patterns and theoretical opportunities. This cycle tested those opportunities against competitive reality, regulatory barriers, and precedent failures. The result: a cleared pipeline and a sharpened methodology.
key_lessons: The Principles Engine (Schumpeter, Minsky, Baumol, Jevons, Coase) correctly identifies disruption patterns. In all 3 cases, the theoretical analysis was RIGHT about the macro forces. The engine's analytical value is confirmed.

Competitive density is a first-class variable. An opportunity where the disruption thesis is correct but $500M+ of capital is already deployed is NOT an opportunity for a $500K-$1M entrant. This must become a mandatory gate.

Regulatory impossibility is absolute. Healthcare nurse ratios are protected by law. No amount of technical capability or capital can override explicit statutory prohibition. Regulatory checks must precede all other analysis for labor-market-adjacent opportunities.

Precedent failures at 100-1000x our capital are dispositive. Bench ($113M) and Olive AI ($1B) failed at the exact theses we proposed. When well-funded, well-executed companies fail at a thesis, we must explain why we would succeed at 1/200th the capital — and 'we use better AI' is not sufficient.

The PROBLEM is always valid when the Principles Engine flags it. All three problems (professional services distress, healthcare shortage, SMB overhead burden) are real and confirmed by hard data. The kills are about solution viability, not problem validity. The problems become scanning targets for DIFFERENT solutions.

kill_index_first_population.K-001: Healthcare Staffing AI — nurse ratio manipulation illegal under H.R. 3415 / S. 1709 + CA SB 596. NNU campaign. 80-99% false alarm rates. Olive AI $1B precedent failure. Epic competing from 42% share.
kill_index_first_population.K-002: Generic SMB Back-Office — Intuit 80%+ moat with $100M OpenAI partnership. Bench.co $113M catastrophic failure. Pilot $325M for 0.4% penetration. 70% paper adoption after 43 years.

top_opportunity_parked.name: Distressed Professional Services Acquisition
top_opportunity_parked.reason: Thesis structurally valid. Competitive landscape at $500M+ vs our $500K-$1M is untenable. Crete, Accrual, Ascend, and 147 PE deals have industrialized the playbook we proposed at 1000x our capital.
reactivation_conditions: PE roll-up Minsky moment — when over-leveraged acquirers face distress
LATAM market showing same cascade with less PE competition
Niche sub-sector identification where PE hasn't arrived

analytical_framework_validation.jevons: Correctly predicted demand expansion at lower costs. Value: identifies TAM expansion. Limitation: does not predict WHO captures expanded demand.
analytical_framework_validation.coase: Correctly predicted firm shrinkage in cognitive industries. Value: identifies structural direction. Limitation: PE roll-ups can capture the transition economics before firm shrinkage completes.
analytical_framework_validation.minsky: Identified potential vulnerability in PE roll-ups (speculative phase). Value: may identify H2-H3 second-order opportunity when roll-ups face distress. Correctly identified that in healthcare, WE would be the speculative actor.
analytical_framework_validation.baumol: Confirmed stored energy in professional services and healthcare. Value: identifies magnitude of disruption potential. Limitation: regulation can preserve cost disease indefinitely (healthcare).
analytical_framework_validation.schumpeter: Correctly identified gap periods. CRITICAL: helped determine that prof services is in 'crowded restructuring' phase, not 'gap period'. Most operationally useful lens for timing decisions.
analytical_framework_validation.summary: The framework proved its value by being RIGHT about the forces and by helping us understand WHY we were wrong about the timing and competitive position. Retaining all 6 lenses. Promoting P7 Timing Arbitrage to confirmed pattern.

transmission_chain_analysis.prof_services_cascade: Confirmed at N4-N5 (firm behavior and labor effect). Advanced to N6 (micro opportunity) but entry window is crowded by institutional capital. Chain fully materialized but not actionable for undercapitalized entrants.
transmission_chain_analysis.healthcare_demographic_gap: Stalled at N5 by regulation. Federal legislation explicitly blocks N5→N6 transition for technology-as-substitute solutions. Chain cannot progress through our proposed mechanism.
transmission_chain_analysis.p7_timing_arbitrage: Confirmed pattern, currently at N3-N4 (industry structure change and firm behavior). HBR data validates the mechanism. HIGH PRIORITY: identify specific sectors where the vacuum exists and is unfilled.
transmission_chain_analysis.construction_labor_gap: Early chain at N2-N3. Immigration policy confirmed as N2 trigger. Needs competitive scan at N3 before advancing.

new_direction.core_pivot: Apply the proven Principles Engine to sectors where PE and well-funded startups have NOT arrived. The framework identifies disruption correctly — we need less crowded terrain.
search_criteria: Sector shows P2 cascade dynamics (declining employment + rising bankruptcies)
Sector does NOT have >$100M of venture/PE capital deployed in AI solutions
Sector is accessible to a 2-person team at $500K-$1M
Sector is not protected by federal regulation blocking AI substitution
Sector has fragmented incumbents (no single player with 80%+ share)
candidate_sectors_for_cycle_7: Veterinary services — fragmented, no PE AI wave, Baumol cost disease present
Translation/localization — AI disruption obvious but PE hasn't industrialized acquisition
Property management — fragmented, high overhead, no dominant AI player
Freight brokerage — middlemen ripe for disintermediation, JOLTS data shows cooling
Print/media production — dead business revival candidate, coordination costs collapsed
new_direction.latam_scan: Priority for Cycle 7. Professional services cascade may exist in Argentina/Brazil with weaker incumbents and zero PE competition. Founder operating access creates unique advantage.
new_direction.p7_sector_identification: Priority for Cycle 7. Which specific sectors have the largest gap between human cuts and AI readiness? These vacuums are the highest-priority scanning targets.

cross_principle_patterns.status: confirmed — promoted from emerging in Cycle 3

next_cycle_direction: Run competitive density scans on Construction AI Coordinator — apply the same counter-signal rigor that killed/parked the top 3
Scan 5-7 new sectors using the search criteria (no >$100M PE/VC, P2 cascade present, fragmented incumbents, no regulatory block)
Add LATAM data sources to Agent A — scan Argentina/Brazil professional services for cascade dynamics with less PE competition
Deep-dive P7 Timing Arbitrage: which sectors have the widest gap between human layoffs and AI delivery readiness?
Add counter_signal_severity (1.5) and competitive_density (1.3) as permanent grading weights
For any opportunity scoring above 60: MANDATORY counter-signal research before advancing to verification
Monitor PE roll-up health quarterly — Crete, Ascend, and Accrual are leveraged bets that may face Minsky distress in H2-H3
Test the Principles Engine on at least 2 sectors where we have NO prior thesis — pure discovery mode
